intro: Hibbertia linearis, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, often appearing in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Hibbertia linearis is a perennial shrub that is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
